snippet: Skeptics of American efforts to arm rebels in Syria have long worried that weapons could be diverted to terrorists. But they did not expect diversion by members of Jordan’s intelligence service....
abstract: Editorial asserts revelation that Jordanian intelligence agents stole arms sent by United States to Syrian rebels and sold them on black market points to risks involved in such arms transfers; says thefts illustrate ways even stalwart allies can undermine American interests.
lead_paragraph: Skeptics of American efforts to arm rebels in Syria have long worried that weapons could be diverted to terrorists. But they did not expect diversion by members of Jordan’s intelligence service.

headline.print_headline: When Friends Like Jordan Steal Weapons
headline.main: When Friends Like Jordan Steal Weapons

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
